column3: Does this really need its own, single-file directory?\n

I'm thinking there should be a standard directory structure, similar to the debian packaging conventions, that would make it easy and predictable to build a package given its source tree.

Since bitcoin is the first project that is interested in adding this to the source tree, you are free to set the standard by choosing where to put it.

From bitcoin's perspective, we don't want to end up with 10 files for 10 different systems (gitian, debian, fedora, ...) each in their own directory.  Having bitcoin/contrib/gitian.yml seems preferable to bitcoin/gitian/just_this_one_file.yml.\n
updated pull looks OK to me, but I'd like to poll gavin's opinion on contrib/ top-level dir as a place to throw things like this\n
